Pertaining to E911 call records and CAD reports, address inquires for adoptions and through DFACs.  1) Processing of requests; 2) comply with Open Records Act; 3)  Public Records retrieval; 4) Electronic Management; Public record imaging and retrieval, archiving and records storage and disposal; 5) Internal and External Customer support service

name: Property & Evidence
description: Receives, documents and safeguards all property and evidence submitted to the custody of the department by maintaining the integrity and security of all items we are entrusted with.  Disposes of items that are not evidentiary in accordance with department policy and Georgia law.

name: Permits & Fingerprinting
description: Permitting for Taxi, Liquor Handling,  Fingerprinting, Weapons Discharge & Solicitors Permits

name: SWAT
description: High risk warrant service, Barricaded Gunman, Tactical Operations, Presentation/demonstrations, Training (North Fulton)

name: Patrol Calls for Service - Emergency
description: Patrol response to emergency calls for service

name: Patrol Calls for Service - Non-Emergency
description: Patrol response to non-emergency calls for service

name: Directed Patrol
description: Aggressive strategic patrol of targeted problem areas

name: Traffic Enforcement
description: Traffic Enforcement, Traffic Safety, Motorcycle enforcement, Presentations, and Enhance public awareness

name: Municipal Court Security
description: Metal detector operation and police presence

name: Maintenance and Repair of waterlines, meters, valves, & hydrants.
description: Maintenance and repair of water supply lines and residential, commercial and irrigation meters.  Location, exercising and repair/ replacement of water distribution system valves.  Repair, maintenance and replacement of hydrants in the water distribution system to ensure public safety (fire protection and safe drinking water/quality).  Includes parts, equipment, tools, machinery, materials for landscape, curb and gutter and pavement repairs.  Includes hydrant flow testing for fire flows, system performance, safety and water model calibration. Includes flushing hydrants, automatic flushing devices, smart hydrants, and waterlines for drinking  water quality purposes.

name: Accident Analysis
description: Conduct yearly crash analysis for intersection and mid-block locations including accident trends/patterns, develop safety improvement projects for all road users.

name: Computerized Traffic Control System
description: Operate and maintain Citys Advanced Traffic Management System, including the Traffic Control Center, field devices, fiber, traffic monitoring cameras, vehicle detection.  Staff manages consultants and coordinate with Georgia Department of Transportation and nearby municipalities, report errors and outages.  Conduct ongoing coordination with GDOTs Regional Traffic Operations Program  (RTOP) and other agencies.

name: Emergency Response

Issue press releases and conduct media interviews.

name: Internal Affairs
description: Investigates internal/external departmental complaints-The mission statement of the Internal Affairs Unit of the Kansas City, Kansas Police Department is to protect the public, the employee and the Department through fair, thorough, and impartial investigations of alleged misconduct. Complaints can initially be made either in person or over the phone. Investigators will then facilitate any reasonable accommodations or meetings, as needed to assist the complainant.Internal Affairs Unit personnel routinely provide training to citizens and others regarding their function and processes. Links from the PD website will also direct complainants to the Unit and officers on all calls provide a comment or complaint card to citizens. Further, concern expressed on our social media platforms will be investigated, when warranted.The PD submits multiple reports regarding various aspects of complaints to both the State and Federal levels for oversight and monitoring. These reports can be accessed through open records requests.The PD provides training to other UG Departments and the Internal Affairs Unit is routinely asked to partner with H.R. and with other agencies to investigate potential violations of employees and others.

name: Sheriff Juvenile Detention Center (JDC) Operations
description:
The Wyandotte County Detention Division provides a safe, secure, and humane environment for staff and persons, both adult and juvenile, lawfully incarcerated by the criminal justice system.
The Wyandotte County Juvenile Detention Center (JDC) provides short-term care and secure custody to juveniles who are awaiting placement or release to parents/guardians. We provide the basic needs for juvenile detainees such as shelter, food, clothing, medical care, mental health and basic hygienic needs.  Our duty is to prevent the abridgement of juvenile detaineesâ€™ legal rights during detainment.  We detain each juvenile in a safe and humane environment, while maintaining the level of security necessary to prevent escape. We ensure that juvenile detainees are free from fear, assault, or any type of intimidation by staff and other juveniles.  
The Detention Centers shall:
â€¢	Adhere to regulations of the Department of Family Services (DFS) regarding juvenile residents.
â€¢	Adhere to performance standards required by Detention Center policies, state statues, Supreme Court and Circuit Court case law.
â€¢	Adhere to all Kansas Department of Corrections (KDOC) mandates regarding juvenile residents.
â€¢	Continue to hire qualified applicants to fill vacancies developed by attrition in order to maintain DFS and KDOC mandatory staffing guidelines regarding Juvenile Detention Officers.
â€¢	Develop and promote exceptionally qualified supervisory and command personnel in 	order to ensure the effective and efficient operation of the JDC and ADC.

name: Sheriff Courthouse Security
description:
The Community and Support Services Division of the Wyandotte County Sheriffâ€™s Office includes the Training Unit; Records Unit; Offender Registration/Concealed Carry Permit Unit; Juvenile Intake and Assessment Center (JIAC); Reserve Deputy Unit, School Resource Officer, and Task Force Officer with the U.S Marshal Service.  Community and Support Services personnel are also responsible for all Information Technology issues.  The Division provides support services to the Operations Division, Adult Detention Center, Juvenile Detention Center, and outside agencies as needed.

â€¢	OFFENDER REGISTRATION/CONCEALED CARRY HANDGUN PERMITS 
Wyandotte County currently has over 1,400 registered drug, sex, and violent offenders who either live, work, or attend school in the county.  Of this number, over 700 are registered for various sex offenses.  In 2018, 182 concealed carry permits were processed, and 755 people were fingerprinted for various reasons.
â€¢	TRAINING UNIT
Three basic training academies for detention deputies were completed in 2018.  In 2019, we will conduct a minimum of 3 basic training academies. In 2018, the Training Unit staff provided over 8,000 man-hours of training.  The Training Unit also conducted 40-hour in-service training for each of our 66 sworn law enforcement officers, per Kansas Statute. 
â€¢	COURTHOUSE SECURITY
In 2019, funds are being added to our budget to create a new Courthouse Security Unit.  It will be under the command of the Community & Support Services Executive Officer.  Initially it will be comprised of 12-armed Court Security Officers, and one supervisor.  They will be responsible for staffing all entry points for the Courthouse, Justice Center, Court Services Building, and the new Juvenile Justice Center when itâ€™s completed.  Additional funding will be needed for 2020 when this unit will increase in staffing level due to the addition of 24-hour, 7 day per week coverage for these buildings.
â€¢	SCHOOL RESOURCE OFFICER
Assigned one deputy as a School Resource Officer for the Bonner Springs School District (Bonner Springs Elementary, Edwardsville Elementary, and Delaware Ridge Elementary).

name: Sheriff â€“ Offender Registration Unit (ORU)
description: Registration/Monitoring of Drug/Sex/Violent Offenders-The Offender Registration Unit serves the community by providing mandated reporting/monitoring of offenders  living in the community who have been convicted of drug/sex/violent offenses.

name: Vehicle and Body Camera Program
description: This program is to improve officer safety, enhance public trust, improve evidence documentation, increase officer accountability, improve officer training, and reduce liability for the Kansas City, Kansas Police Department and the Unified Government by capturing and documenting citizen contacts.

name: Explosive Ordinance Disposal (EOD)
description: Responds to calls in Kansas City, KS of explosive devices, incendiary devices, explosives, pyrotechnics and render safe and remove devices.  The unit will provide safe transportation of devices for storage or disposal.  The Unit also assists with large scale events such as Sporting games and NASCAR and assists with bomb detection.

name: Crime Intel Unit
description: Responsible for gathering, analyzing, and disseminating information as related to crime statistics, fugitive apprehension, and crime prevention.

name: UG Security
description: Unified Government Security Officers are guardians of the property that the public has placed in our care both in consideration of the physical structures and the safety of those that serve and are served within them.

name: Disaster Aid Management
description: By law, all state and federal disaster aid programs and related tasks/reports/reimbursements must be channeled through the county Emergency Management office. Assist and advocate for local public and private applicants.

name: Emergency Operations Center (EOC) Management
description: Must acquire and maintain the equipment and supplies needed to open and run the EOC. Must attempt to track and alert EOC staff as needed. Once opened, must coordinate EOC operations and assure staffing and supplies for extended operational periods.

name: Emergency Management Exercises
description: Promote and facilitate exercises to test responder competencies (gained through training) and existing plans/procedures for effectiveness and their realistic reflection of current capabilities. After an exercise there must be analysis and corrective actions taken to incorporate "lessons learned" into future plan updates and training.

name: Hazard Mitigation
description: Promote and coordinate the various federal and state mitigation programs available to local units of government within the county that if utilized, will help lessen the impact and cost of future disasters and make communities more resilient.

name: Hazardous Materials Programs and Response
description: Attempt to assure compliance with all mandated Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know (EPCRA) laws and regulations and facilitate the existence of the mandated Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and all of it's duties. Help assure the capabilities and readiness of a hazardous materials response team that has responsibilities as a local asset as well as a state resource. Administer related grants, programs and training as needed/requested. Respond to hazardous material emergency scenes and perform mandated duties 24/7/365.

name: Incident Management
description: Promote the adoption and use of both the National Incident Management System (NIMS) and the Incident Command System (ICS) for planned and no notice public safety events/incidents. These systems are mandated by state and federal law to be used during emergencies and apply to both government and non governmental agencies involved in response and recovery.

name: Emergency Management Inter-Agency Coordination and Liaison
description: By state law, each county in WI must designate an emergency manager but that position has no authority attached to it. That means that to do the job, contact needs to be made with numerous internal and external preparedness/response/recovery partner agencies and individuals at the local, regional, state and federal levels. These relationships are maintained through various means such as information sharing, meetings, training, exercising, etc. the process is constant as turnover occurs and the current needs/situations change. This office strives to properly deliver the services/coordination we offer, maintain our visibility/relevance and always attempt to be considered a valued partner to the agencies/organizations/individuals we work with.

name: Emergency Preparedness Outreach and Education
description: Constant process of attempting to prepare individuals, schools, business, communities, etc. with information and ideas to stay safe and be better prepared for emergencies/disaster. Many differing communications platforms tailored to specific audiences are needed.

name: Emergency Preparedness Planning
description: Developing, reviewing, updating and maintaining all-hazards and hazard specific plans (both internal to the county and involving external partners) at the local, regional and state levels. Certain plans are mandated to be reviewed and updated annually and others become a priority based on current conditions. Also asked to review and/or provide input/feedback on plans maintained by other agencies/jurisdictions on an as needed basis.

name: Emergency Resource Management
description: Assist with identifying, vetting, typing, acquiring, deploying and demobilizing resources - both staffing and equipment - for use during emergencies, disasters and exercises.

name: Emergency Event Response
description: This office is on call 24/7/365 to respond to scenes or assist from support facilities such as county dispatch or the local or county Emergency Operations Center. Most events requiring response are no notice and most severe weather hazards have only short time frame advance warning periods.

name: Emergency Preparedness Training
description: Assuring proper training for public safety responders and other response/recovery partners in specific topics that are not provided through other venues. Involves training grant solicitation/administration, instructor contracting, course material acquisition, venue scheduling, student recruitment and required class follow up. Constantly strive to maintain and enhance staff Emergency Management knowledge/skills/best practices through formal and informal means.

name: Volunteer Coordination
description: Emergencies and disasters almost always involve volunteers - those that are requested to respond and those that just show up to help. The unrequested "spontaneous volunteers" need to be registered, assigned, trained, supervised, and equipped to be safe, effective and kept from being counterproductive. This is a management challenge within, but separate from, the larger incident management operation.

name: Court Orders
description: Review draft orders filed with the office by litigants and attorneys. Inform court official of any potential issues prior to obtaining the court official's signature. May prepare draft orders for the court official. Prepare judgments of conviction and civil judgments.

name: Jury
description: Compile prospective juror lists, prepare jury summonses, obtain a sufficient number of jurors, coordinate jury selection, provide jury supplies, review fees and mileage for disbursement

name: Prosecution - Food Safety Recreational Licensing
description: Administratively resolve licensing issues. Enforcement of Orders and prosecution of violations 8.21, Ch. 97 and 251 and DHS 172-198

name: Prosecution - Guardianship, Protective Placement, Elder Abuse, Emergency Protective Placement
description: Conducts proceedings 54, 55.02(3), 55.135, 4.02(5)(i)-determine competency and placement

name: Prosecution - Human Health Hazards
description: Initiate legal action to abate hazards 8.05(2)(e)

name: Prosecution - Mental Commitment Cases
description: Represent the interests of the public 51.20(4)-involuntary and voluntary mental commitment

name: Prosecution - Public Onsite Water Treatment Systems; Shoreland, Wetland, Floodplain Zoning violations; and Parks entrance fee violations
description:
Enforcement of zoning, sanitary and other land use regulations 4.02(5)(d) and 25.17(4)
Enforcement of Parks entrance fee violations

name: Prosecution - Termination of Parental Rights Cases
description: Represent the interests of the public - 48.09(5)-terminate parental rights

name: Training - Emergency Detentions/Protective Placement
description: In-service training for law enforcement 51.15(11m)

name: Adjudication of Traffic and Ordinance Citations (Adult) pursuant to Wash. Co. Code 4.02(f)
description: Negotiate and handle thousands of traffic and ordinance citations written by the State Patrol, Sheriff's Department and DNR.

name: Adjudication of Traffic and Ordinance Citations (Juv) pursuant to Wash. Co. Code 4.02(f)
description: Negotiate and handle juvenile ordinance violations, such as underage drinking.

name: Appeals, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(5)
description: Handle post-conviction motions for new trials, ineffective assistance, and misdemeanor appeals.

name: Domestic Violence and Sexual Assault Charging Conferences, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Conduct domestic violence meetings pursuant to statute, assist victims with preparing and filing restraining orders.

name: Citizen Inquiries and Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Correspond with citizens about items of concern.

name: Civil Litigation (Forfeiture), pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(2)
description: Preparation of documents for drug civil forfeiture actions, such as vehicle seizures.

name: Criminal Complaints, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 968.02
description: Review police reports from eleven law enforcement agencies for potential criminal charges, which number thousands of cases.

name: Discovery, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.23(1)
description: Provide copies on police reports and digital media to defense counsel, pursuant to statute.

name: Document Preparation, Review and Approval, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Prepare criminal complaints for each case issued, as well as motions and briefs where needed for the prosecution of the case.

name: Search Warrants, Subpoenas and Law Enforcement Agency Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 968.12 and 968.135
description: Assist with search warrants, subpoenas and some aspects of investigation in complicated matters.

name: Trial and Prosecution Records Maintenance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.07
description: Maintain records and files for court dates and prosecution.

name: Motions, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.31
description: File and respond to motions from defense attorneys in order to effectively prosecute charged cases.

name: Plea and Sentencing and Court Escort, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Negotiate charged cases and appear on behalf of the State at plea and sentencing hearings.

name: Prosecuting Case Management (Adult), pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(2)
description: Organize and maintain files for adult criminal cases.

name: Prosecuting Case Management (Juvenile), pursuant to Wis. Stat. 938.25(1)
description: Organize and maintain files for juvenile delinquency and children in need of protection and/or services (such as neglect cases).

name: Law Enforcement Agencies Inquiries and Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Monitor reception area, take calls from law enforcement and attorneys, seek to respond to questions and complaints from citizens.

name: Attorney Inquiries and Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Monitor reception area, take calls from law enforcement and attorneys, seek to respond to questions and complaints from citizens.

name: Records Retention, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.07
description: Retain files pursuant to office policy.

name: Restitution, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 973.20
description: Determine restitution amount to be ordered by the court, provide this information to the Department of Corrections for collection.

name: Criminal Trials, including assisting victims and witnesses, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Prepare for and conduct criminal jury trials.

name: Victims Rights, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 950.04
description: Contact and inform crime victims of their rights under statute, inform victims of case status when requested and guide victims through criminal justice system.

name: Witnesses, including subpoenas, cancellations and trial prep, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Assist in preparing victims & witnesses for trial; escort victims & witnesses into courtroom for trial; cancel witnesses if not needed.

name: Worthless Checks, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 973.20
description: Prosecute, draft demand letters and otherwise seek to collect funds for worthless checks written to county businesses.

name: Joint Public Health Services
description: Intergovernmental agreement with Ozaukee County for joint public health services

name: Asphalt Inspection
description: Inspect construction of asphalt projects

name: Bridge Inspection
description: Perform bridge inspections for county and local municipalities

name: Emergency Disaster Response
description: Respond to any disasters in county

name: Traffic Engineering Studies
description: Review traffic studies

name: Anti-Icing Road Treatment
description: Apply liquid anti-icing chemicals prior to the start of a storm or icing event, including frost and black ice prevention.  Shed to shed within county.

name: Asphalt Chip Seal Coating
description: Placing asphalt material and cover aggregate to seal surface of pavement.

name: Asphalt Crack Sealing
description: Routing, cleaning, and filling of pavement cracks with a crack sealant to prevent infiltration, maintain safety and improve ride.

name: Asphalt Milling/Bump Removal
description: Milling of pavement to provide a smoother driving surface and/or to drain wheel ruts. Removal of pavement material to correct individual localized bumps; create rumble strips and localized pulverizing.

name: Asphalt Spot Repair/Pothole Repair
description: Minor repairs of pavement distress generally not exceeding 50 feet in one lane. Filling of depressions in the pavement surface with asphalt materials.

name: Asphalt Thin Surface Coat
description: Placing asphalt paving materials to extend the life of existing pavement and improve ride.

name: Asphalt Wedging/Rut Filling
description: Placing asphalt paving material in wheel ruts to bring the highway cross section back to its original condition. This does not include bridge approaches.

name: Drainage Structure Cleaning & Repair
description: Cleaning and maintaining catch basins, culverts, inlets, storm sewers, flumes, rip rap or any other drainage structures. Includes replacement of failed culverts.

name: Hazardous Debris Removal
description: Removing objects from roadways which may impact safe travel, including rubber.

name: Roadway Safety Appurtenances Maintenance
description: Maintenance and repair of security fence, reflectors, delineators, median barriers, attenuators, noise barriers, retaining walls, culvert posts, and guardrail, which goes beyond abutment of a bridge structure.

name: Pavement Marking
description: Includes all county labor, materials, and equipment in performing pavement marking activities.

name: Distressed Pavement  Repair
description: Cold mill, thin resurfacing, crack filling, mud jacking, and diamond grinding.

name: Asphalt Shoulders Placement and Repair
description: Placement or repair of paved shoulders including asphalt or concrete. This work may include rumble strip(s) installation.

name: Gravel Shoulders Maintenance
description: Reshaping existing gravel or add gravel in order to eliminate drop-offs and maintain safety.

name: Substructure Maintenance and Repair
description: Maintenance and repairs of abutments, wing walls, piers, and piling. This includes repair and rehabilitation from the effects of scour.

name: Bridge Substructure Maintenance and Repair
description: Maintenance and repair of bridge decks, approach, sealing bridge decks, drainage systems, girders, railings, bearings and joints.

name: Waterway Slope Repair
description: Maintenance and repair of abutment slopes rip rap and the natural waterway embankments.

name: Surveillance and Patrol
description: Includes travel time to and from section and patrolling the section as related to any maintenance activities within the right of way.

name: Pavement Sweeping
description: Removal and disposal of debris from either asphalt or concrete pavement or paved shoulders with a sweeper, mechanical means, or by hand. This includes the cost of disposal fees.

name: Traffic Control
description: Includes placing and removal of signs, cones, impact attenuators, arrow boards, and other devices. Also includes provision of flagging operations for work zones related to maintenance activities. This also includes placement and maintenance of traffic control devices needed for detours, accidents, emergencies or any other event not related to maintenance activities.

name: Permanent Traffic Sign Placement
description: Installation of new traffic signs and scheduled replacement of traffic signs.

name: Permanent Traffic Sign Repair
description: Permanent repair of traffic signs and supports. This includes use with the statewide damage claim number.

name: Temporary Traffic Sign Repair
description: Temporary repair of signs that need immediate response time such as stop signs, etc. This includes use with the statewide damage claim number.

name: Winter Snow Plowing and Chemical Application
description: Plowing snow and applying agents during precipitation event. Loading salt into trucks during storm event. Applying abrasives during storm event. Assisting emergency vehicles during storm event.  Assisting emergency vehicles during non-storm time for winter related activities. Frost runs. Clean-up after emergency situation. Storm related clean up. Drift control. Clean-up. Winging or benching. Response to refreeze of chemicals on pavement. Applying abrasives after storm event. Addressing icing areas. Treating refreeze conditions.

name: Court Services
description: Specialized Testimony, completion of Petitions for at risk clients, and interdisciplinary team reports for the court

name: Court-Ordered Annual Protective Placement Assessment
description: Assessment to determine if client meets legal criteria for Court ordered protective placement.

name: Emergency Services Funds Program
description: Provide funds for needed items to ensure the safety of the client.

name: Investigations - Vulnerable Adults at Risk
description: Investigations of cases pertaining to neglect, self-neglect, abuse or financial exploitation.

name: Protective Placement
description: Facilitate a court order to place someone in a safe place.

name: Welfare Checks
description: Unannounced visits to persons who are at risk of neglect or abuse

name: Acute Care
description: 24/7 Mobile Crisis Teams and Call Center that completes crisis assessments, safety plans and serves as a gatekeeper for the Chapter 51 process of emergency detention (working with Law Enforcement).  Works directly in the community with clients, professionals and families in crisis.  Works with Law Enforcement, the Jail, Schools, other systems as needed.  Monitors and supports clients who have through the ACS Program been placed in the hospital.  Works to transition clients safely and with all needed supports back to the community. Support guardianship, case management, court services, protective placements and general support for vulnerable adults and welfare checks in the community.

name: CCS and CSP - Case Management  and Service Facilitation
description: Case Management for approximately 140 clients with severe and chronic mental illness and AODA concerns; program includes assessment, service plan development, links to other needed services, collateral contacts and teamwork with external providers.  CMs meet regularly with Psychiatrists, Nursing Staff, Therapists, and other connected professionals to assure continuity of care and excellent

name: CCS and CSP - Medication Management
description: Nurses work directly with chronically MI clients, preparing and delivering medications to clients daily.  Med run occurs and is conducted by both SW and MH Tech staff; clients receive medication management and education from RNs and to a lesser extent from SW and Tech staff.  Designed to improve medication adherence and keep clients well, safe and in the community.

name: CCS and CSP - Mental Health Tech Services
description: MH Techs provide a host of daily living skills and other in community supports designed to assist clients to live more independently in the community.  MH Techs provide links to other community providers, take clients shopping, help clients maintain a safe and organized home, deliver and witness med administration, and are an active member of the CCS and CSP teams. Provided by an external agency, Elevate, Inc., and billed through CCS and CSP Programs.  MH Techs provide a host of daily living skills and other in community supports designed to assist clients to live more independently in the community.  MH Techs provide links to other community providers, take clients shopping, help clients maintain a safe and organized home, deliver and witness med administration, and are an active member of the CCS and CSP teams.

name: CCS and CSP-Nursing Services
description: Registered Nurses support clients who are open to the CCS and CSP programs; they are the go between between  client and doctor; they assure timely refills, provide medication management services, receive and communicate lag results, and communicate and provide support for adverse side effects.  RNs serve as a member of the program teams and interact regularly with psychotherapists, CMs, and Psychiatrists.

name: CCS and CSP-Psychiatry Services
description: Psychiatrists provide initial evaluations, prescriptions, and ongoing medication management to clients with chronic MI and AODA issues within CCS and CSP.

name: CCS and CSP-Psychotherapy Services
description: Licensed Psychotherapists (SWs and Counselors) provide assessments, service plan development, and ongoing, goal oriented psychotherapy for clients with chronic mental illness and AODA concerns with CCS and CSP Programs.

name: Community Support Program (CSP) Assessment, Service Plan Development and Administration
description: Intensive CM program that provides at least weekly services to  adults who meet program eligibility .  HSD employs licensed therapists, Bachelor level CMs, Nurses, MH Techs, IPS and some residential services provided by external agencies to improve health outcomes and promote recovery for chronically MI clients.  CSP includes an application and admission process, a comprehensive assessment, service plan development process, and ongoing service delivery, provider management and service coordination.  Clients are reassessed and new plans are developed for each client  every six months.

name: Comprehensive Community Services (CCS) Assessment, Service Plan Development and Administration
description: Intensive CM program that provides more intensive and frequent services to  children and adults who meet program eligibility .  HSD employs licensed therapists, Bachelor level CMs, Nurses, MH Techs, and a host of other external services provided by external agencies to improve health outcomes and promote recovery for chronically MI clients.  CCS includes an application and admission process, a comprehensive assessment, service plan development process, and ongoing service delivery, provider management and service coordination.  Clients are reassessed and new plans are developed for each client  every six months.

name: Family Care Allocation
description: HSD allocates a predetermined amount annually to in part fund Family Care (Partnership Program, Family Care Program) Services for Washington County residents.  WA County residents who meet the functional and financial requirements for the program gain access to team-based care, some of which is funded directly by a Managed Care Organization and some of it funded through State Medicaid insurance.  Access to the program is accomplished through contact with the Aging and Disability Resource Center (ADRC), who completes a functional screen and assessment on the client.  Our own Economic Support Division supplies financial eligibility information to the ADRC, and then admission is determined.

name: AODA Outpatient Services
description: Provides AODA outpatient services to groups and indivudal clients with MA or no insurance.  A good number of uninsured or MA insured IDP clients utilize this program for treatment.  Treatment includes assessment, service planning, and ongoing treatment.

name: Inpatient Hospitalization
description: Multiple providers across the region who accept voluntary and involuntary clients for mental health hospitalizations, crisis stabilization and transition back to the community.

name: Intoxicated Driver Program
description: Managed by Elevate, Inc. , this program assesses and creates a safety plan for all clients who have been charged with an OWI Offense.  Clients pay for the assessment and safety plan process and then follow through on recommendations per safety plan with other tx or educational providers in the community. The program is completely client-funded and operational costs do not hit the County's books.

name: 24/7 Residential Services (includes Supportive HC/Apartment, CBRF, and AFH)
description: Includes varying degrees of 24/7 support and skill delivery for clients who are struggling with chronic mental illness and requires a much more in depth level of support and attention.  Clients in this program cannot live safely in the community, take their medication independently, routinely, and are at risk for being exploited.

name: Lifespan - Community Outpatient Services Case Management
description: Case Management for approximately 100 clients with severe and chronic mental illness and substance use disorders; program includes assessment, service plan development, links to other needed services, collateral contacts and teamwork with external providers.  CMs meet regularly with Psychiatrists, Nursing Staff, Therapists, and other connected professionals to assure continuity of care and excellent client outcomes.

name: Lifespan - Intake & Orientation
description: Client contacts via phone and walk in, Client intake, processing of the welcome packet, collecting all required (non-clinical) paper work, releases of information, scheduling of client into "appropriate" program, and educating clients regarding expectations.

name: Lifespan - Nursing Services
description: Registered Nurses (RN) support clients who are open to the Lifespan Psychiatry program; they are the go between between client and doctor; they assure timely refills, provide medication management services, receive and communicate lag results, and communicate and provide support for adverse side effects.  RNs serve as a member of the Lifespan team and interact regularly with psychotherapists, case managers, and Psychiatrists.

name: Lifespan - Psychiatry Services
description: Psychiatrists provide initial evaluations, prescriptions, and ongoing medication management to clients with chronic MI and AODA issues.

name: Lifespan - Psychotherapy Service
description: Licensed Psychotherapists (SWs and Counselors) provide assessments, service plan development, and ongoing, goal oriented psychotherapy for clients with chronic mental illness and AODA concerns.

name: Patient Assistance Program
description: Brief assessment, application processing, and ongoing check in and support for uninsured clients with needs for psychotropic medications (and no ability to pay).  Medications are provided free of charge or for small co-pays from pharmaceutical corporations.

name: Representative Payee Program
description: Provided by an in house HSD staff and MH Tech.  Serves as Rep Payee for 85 clients who are open in CCS, CSP, and COPS Programs.  Balances accounts, processes and provides checks, pays bills, helps assure eligibility timelines for insurance and SSI are met.

name: Saint A - School Based Trauma Informed Psychotherapy Services
description: Run by Saint A, this program serves approximately 50 children per year, providing Trauma Informed Psychotherapy to children who have experienced an adverse event and are acting out and struggling in school.  Designed to be a preventative program that can keep children out of the more formal BH System.  Program also works to build trauma informed and sensitive schools, training teachers, child by child, helping them understand and implement better behavior support plans.

name: Treatment, Alternatives and Diversion (TAD) Program
description: Run by Elevate, Inc., this program is designed to divert jail and prison bed days and mandate treatment instead for clients who have received 2nd, 3rd, and 4th time Operating while Intoxicated offenses.  Program includes assessment, service planning, frequent client contact, linkages to treatment and drug testing.

name: Birth to Three Program
description: Implement in-home services to children with 25% or more deficits in speech/language and physical abilities.

name: Children's Waivers
description: Provide daily living skills, community support and respite.

name: Children's Long-Term Support (CLTS) Program
description: 3 (FT) Children's Long-Term Support workers (CLTS) are responsible for the implementation of the CLTS programs which includes adhering to the State Waiver mandates, following all Family Support Guidelines assisting families in maintaining their special needs children within their homes and all related case management duties.

name: Family Support
description: Funding allotted to families for disability related expenses that are not covered by T19, Katie Beckett or private insurance.

name: Acute Care - Psychiatry
description: Staff psychiatrist.

name: Case Management - MH and AODA
description: Case management for behavioral health programs.

name: Psychiatric Evaluations
description: Program includes records reviews and face to face evaluations of clients who are either on commitment, or have been placed in an inpatient unit (emergency detained).  Part of Washington County’s mandate to assure residents are not a danger to themselves or others.

name: Transitional Apartments
description: Provides four studio apartments to help clients with chronic mental illness.

name: Dodge County Clearview Mental Health Facility-IMD
description: Locked mental health facility in Juno, WI used for clients who are a danger to themselves, are on commitment with WA County, and need the increased security and support to develop the skills to live independently and safely in the community.

name: Child Protective Services (CPS) - Access and Initial Assessment
description: 5 Full Time MSWs are responsible for Access and Initial Assessment duties in Child Protective Services as mandated by Chapter 48 of the Wisconsin State Statutes.  This unit is responsible for screening decisions on all CPS referrals, conducting all investigations and CPS court referrals.

name: Child Protective Services (CPS) - Alternate Care
description: 2 (FT) MSWs and 1(FT) BSW perform all mandated activities pertaining to a child in an out-of-home placement.  This includes court work, paperwork as mandated by DCF, face-to-face contacts and coordination of all services.

name: Court Assessments
description: 2 (FT) Social Worker positions are responsible for conducting all interviews and information gathering related to the development of a report to court which includes recommendations for disposition.

name: Court Intake
description: 1 (FT) Social Worker position is responsible for receiving, screening, and managing all Juvenile Intake referrals from law enforcement.

name: Family Court
description: 2 (FT) Masters Level Social Workers, each have half (1/2) their caseload dedicated to Family Court Services.  These positions conduct court-ordered custody investigations and make recommendations to the court on custody and placement of children when their parents are unable to resolve this independently.

name: Foster Care Coordinator
description: 1 (PT) BSW is responsible for managing all Kinship Care placements, as well as recruiting, licensing, training and maintaining foster homes for Washington County.

name: GPS Monitoring (Global Positioning Satellite)
description: Monitors youth who are court-ordered to wear an electronic monitoring unit.

name: Kinship Care Benefits Program
description: Provides funds to unlicensed relative care providers.

name: Child Protective Services (CPS) - Ongoing Monitoring and Case Management
description: 1 (FT) MSW and 3 (FT) Bachelor of Social Work (BSW) level staff are responsible for the implementation of all court orders pertaining to Child Abuse and Neglect.  Workers monitor for safety and compliance, conduct home visits, develop treatment plans, complete all state mandated paperwork, and meet all state-required time frames.  Workers are responsible for all court related activity as well as service referrals and case management activity.

name: Juvenile Justice (JJ) - Ongoing Monitoring and Case Management
description: 4 (FT) MSWs and 3 (FT) BSWs are responsible for providing all duties associated with court-ordered supervision.  This includes, conducting home visits, developing treatment plans, court work, all case management duties and complying with all DCF and DOC mandates, guidelines and timeframes.

name: Out-of-Home Care
description: Provide structure, support and programming for children and youth unable to be maintained in their home.  Services include individual, group and family therapy, education, recreation and medical coordination.  Provides facilities licensed by the State of Wisconsin in the areas of:  Treatment Foster Care, Residential Care Centers and Corrections (Lincoln Hills).

name: Parent Aides
description: 1 (FT) and 2 (PT) Family Aides are trained to provide the Nurturing Program, Budgeting, Household Management, Parenting and referrals to community supports/resources.  They are also responsible for transportation and  monitoring all court-ordered supervised visitation.

name: Restorative Justice
description: Provides programming to youth on supervision that have court orders for restitution, community service and/or Restorative Justice.

name: Safety Services
description: Provides services to insure children can safely remain in their home.

name: Shelter/Youth Treatment Center
description: Provides a 14-bed facility offering services to Shelter (6-bed capacity) and residential treatment (8-bed capacity) placements.

name: Supervised Visitation
description: Provides a structured, home-like atmosphere to those parents requiring supervised contact with their children.

name: Truancy Intake & Assessment
description: 1 (PT) Social Worker is responsible for conducting all interviews and information gathering for screening of truancy referrals, developing deferred prosecutions or completing the court referral process.

name: Medico-Legal Death Investigation
description: Investigate deaths reported to our office under Wi St. 979.01. Includes transporting decedents from scene of death to morgue or autopsy facility as necessary.

name: Forensic Autopsy
description: Contracted with Waukesha County for some forensic autopsy services.

name: Mobile Data Terminals
description: Maintenance of the mobile data terminals installed in department squads.

name: Emergency Fire / EMS Communications
description: Emergency dispatch phone and radio communications provided for Fire and EMS agencies.

name: Emergency Police Communications
description: Emergency dispatch phone and radio communications provided for the Sheriff's Office and police agencies.

name: Mapping and GIS Management
description: Liaison with county GIS, town and county governments to maintain accurate     9-1-1 address mapping throughout the county.

name: Non- Emergency Fire / EMS Communications
description: Non-emergency dispatch phone and radio communications provided for Fire and EMS agencies.

name: Huber Work Release Program
description: Inmates who are sentenced to Jail are often ordered by the Judge to have Huber or work release privileges under Wisconsin Statute 303.08.

name: Incarceration of Adult Inmates - Straight Time
description: The general incarceration of inmates from pre-sentence detainees through sentenced detainees (without Huber).  This is done in compliance with Wisconsin DOC 350.

name: Incarceration of Washington County Juveniles
description: The general incarceration of Juvenile Offenders who are residents of Washington County.  This is done in compliance with Wisconsin DOC 346.

name: Justice / Government Center Security
description: Security services provided to the Justice Center by sworn full and part time staff of the department.

name: Justice Center Screening
description: Security screening service provided to the Justice Center by sworn part time staff of the department.

name: Most Wanted Files
description: Public relations program highlighting wanted criminals which are featured in the media and department website.

name: Transport & Extradition of Prisoners
description: Transportation of prisoners to and from court and secure facilities by sworn full and part time staff of the department.

name: Evidence & Property Management
description: Management of the department's evidence and evidence storage, forensic analysis, transport of evidence and records maintenance

name: Forensic Video Management
description: Management of the department's interview video and audio recording systems.

name: Specialized & Crime Scene Investigations
description: Investigations and crime scene management assigned to the Detective Bureau.

name: Accident Investigations
description: Patrol dedicated time for accident investigations.

name: Commercial Motor Vehicle Enforcement
description: Commercial motor vehicle enforcement.

name: General Investigations
description: Patrol dedicated time for investigations.

name: General Patrol Operations
description: Operations related to routine patrol not dedicated to other specific law enforcement and police functions.

name: Police Contracting - Richfield
description: Resources associated with the provision of police services to the Village of Richfield.

name: Recreational Patrol
description: Recreational enforcement activity with the use of specialized vehicles.

name: Sex Offender Accountability
description: Program in which deputies conduct unannounced visits with registered sex offenders located in the county to verify registration requirements.

name: Special Teams
description: Activity associated with the management, training and deployment of the department's SWAT, Dive, Canine and Accident Reconstruction Teams.

name: Traffic Enforcement
description: Patrol dedicated time for traffic enforcement.

name: Radio Infrastructure Maintenance
description: Maintenance and oversight of the county wide radio system tower sites and related infrastructure.

name: Radio Network Administration & Maintenance
description: Administration of the county wide radio system IT network.

name: Narcotics Investigation
description: Investigations and crime scene management assigned to the Drug Unit.

name: Undercover Operations
description: Recruitment, hiring, training and management of undercover officers.

name: Field Training Program
description: Administration of field training program for newly hired Corrections, Communications and Patrol officers.

name: Dispatch Services - Communications
description: Dispatch, 9-1-1 Operations, Dispatching Police, Fire, Utilities, to include the processing of calls of service for emergency and non-emergency calls for police, fire, medical calls, call taking and recording of calls into the CAD System.

name: Traffic Safety Program and Crash Investigations
description: Investigate traffic crashes and enforce municipal ordinances and state statutes for on and off highway violations.  Education of traffic safety and regulations and the processing and handling of State Traffic Grants for equipment and overtime.

name: Preventive Patrol
description: Attempt to eliminate opportunity for misconduct through police presence in areas of expected crime utilizing different patrol tactics and strategies including preventative police patrol, team policing high visibility and low visibility patrol for the prevention of crime, enforcement of all laws, the arrest and prosecution of criminals and the protection of life and property.  Actively search for wanted individuals.

name: Emergency Management Program
description: Operation of Emergency Management System by Maintaining emergency communications plans and communication rooms, to include Emergency Preparedness Outreach and Resource Management.

name: Early Warning System Management
description: Coordinator of the mass notification system to include Early Warning System Management and Tornado Siren System

name: Trash Collection and Transportation to Landfill
description: Collect trash from commercial and residential customers

name: Fire Hydrant Inspection and Maintenance
description: Fire hydrants are inspected and tested to verify that they are working properly   Repairs are performed as needed

name: National Flood Insurance Program-Floodplain Management
description: As required by the Federal Emergency Management Agency/NFIP and the State, regulate development within special flood hazard areas identified by FEMA and UDFCD.   Review development and issue permits for activities within floodplains

name: Building Inspections
description: Performs inspections of residential, commercial, and industrial buildings and properties both in person and virtually. Inspects properties for habitability and safe occupancy.

name: Bio-solids land application
description: Tracking, reporting and testing of land applied solids to include field testing.

name: Treatment Plant Operations
description: Maintenance of all components and equipment within the Water Treatment Plant and daily operations

name: Lift Stations
description: Operation and maintenance of sewage lift stations.

name: Sanitary Sewer Collection Operations
description: Cleaning of the wastewater collection system to prevent sanitary sewer overflows and maintain proper operation. Utilization of jet trucks with high pressure water nozzles to perform routine maintenance, cleaning, clear blockages, root cutting, grease removal and monitoring of sanitary sewer infrastructure.

name: Sewer Treatment Operations
description: Maintenance of all components and equipment within the Water Treatment Plant, system operations

name: Wells and Towers
description: Monitoring and maintenance of facilities associated with wells, towers and booster stations

name: Health Inspections
description: Inspections of food service establishments, temporary establishments, manufacturers, and others as needed. Handling of complaints related to food service establishments.

name: Rescue Operations
description: Rescue people and mitigate a diverse range of technical emergencies including such matters as water/river incidents, entrapment, incidents at heights or below grade, and motor vehicle collisions.

name: Medical First Response
description: Mitigate a diverse range of serious and life threatening medical emergencies in aid and support.

name: Hazardous Materials Response
description: Coordination with in Region G and State of MO to provide emergency response and implement mitigation strategies for the release of hazardous materials.

name: Fire Hydrant Maintenance
description: Service (oil) and grass and weed control of all city fire hydrants

name: Region G All Hazard Response Team
description: Maintain records and equipment on Federal Emergency Management Agency  (FEMA)  qualified typed resources available for deployment anywhere necessary for emergency situations.

name: Fire Inspections
description: Fire inspections for businesses  daycares  homecare facilities  and adult and senior care facilities  fireworks  hospitals  schools  and special events

name: Fire Response
description: All management processes, associated fees, fleet, training, equipment for extinguishment and special skills/operations to protect lives and to prevent the destruction of property

name: Emergency Medical Response
description: Pre-hospital care provided to the Medical First Responder level, assist with requests from EMS.

name: Fire Investigations
description: Fire origin and cause  fire watch  and assist law enforcement with criminal investigation

name: Fire Response
description: All types of fires, Motor Vehicle Collisions, Hazardous Materials Incidents, Alarm Activations, Ice and Water Rescue.

name: Community Requests for Assistance
description: Assist RCMP, Fire Services, City Departments, Outside Agencies and the public as requested.

name: Emergency Response
description: Response for medical calls, motor vehicle collisions, structure fires, and other public safety emergencies.

name: RCMP Policing Services
description: Contract with Public Safety Canada that designates the RCMP as the Municipal Police Service.  The RCMP provides services necessary to preserve the peace, protect life and property, prevent crime and offences against the laws of Canada and Alberta.  The service include: community policing and victim services, crime reduction, drug enforcement, general duty policing, traffic enforcement and general investigation.

name: Fairgrounds Facility Building Maintenance
description: Cleaning of the facility inventory of tables and chairs and other minor repairs as needed. Facility upkeep of 16 structures Plumbing Electrical Heating ventilation air conditioning maintenance and repairs

name: Fairgrounds Grounds Maintenance
description: Fencing and gates, arena's,  and cleanup of the property

name: Fairgrounds Parking Lot and Roadway Maintenance
description: Maintain parking lots gravel roads and lots

name: Equipment maintenance
description: Maintain all vehicles,tractors, drags, skidsteers, waterwagons, snow removal equipment and trailers

name: Public Health Preparedness
description: Prepares and follows county wide and/or statewide disaster plans. Communicates information to the public and collaborates with partners to meet the needs of the public. Train staff to respond in an emergency. Complete table top & emergency drills/exercises. Provides 24/7 on-call in the event of an outbreak or disaster. Train with police, fire, Emergency Management and EMS, respond to emergencies, outbreaks and disasters.

name: Environmental Health
description: Responsible for licensing and inspections of food vendors, school kitchens, restaurants, hotels/motels, swimming pools, following-up on human health hazard complaints, radon, asbestos, air & water quality; water testing for outbreaks, newborns, pregnant women and after flooding.. Investigations on high blood level results. Provides 24/7 on-call.

name: Communicable & Chronic Disease Prevention
description: This is a State mandated program and takes priority over all other Health Department services. Public Health Nurses track, analyze and trend infectious disease processes, reporting these results to physicians and the State through WEDSS as required to minimize infectious outbreaks. Nurses follow-up with individuals/families/contacts of diagnosed or suspect communicable disease cases to provide education and prevention of further cases. Public Health staff respond immediately to infectious disease outbreaks and pandemics.

name: Mental Health Services - Outpatient Program - Injections
description: Registered Nurses administer mental health injections in the Health Department clinic under doctor orders for clients who have a need for injectable mental health medications due to their mental health diagnosis. Jefferson County Human Services is billed per injection on a monthly basis.

name: Public Health Clinic Services
description: Public Health Nurses provide blood pressure checks, pregnancy tests, TB skin tests, immunizations, health education, dental varnishes and well child checks to qualifying clients.

name: Maternal and Child Health Consolidated Contract Grant
description: Health Department staff collaborate with community partners to build a system of care for families including child death prevention through the Child Death Review Team. Recommendations for services are implemented by team members. With support from The Greater Watertown Community Health Foundation and collaboration with partners within the "Every Child Thrives" initiative, the Health Department has implemented the "TalkReadPlay" Home Visit Program utilizing evidence-based curriculum, Parents as Teachers. The program is available for all families residing in Jefferson County starting prenatally through a child's third year of age. Public Health Nurses provide home visits to families with newborns or in need of parenting support.

name: Prenatal Care Coordination (PNCC)
description: Public Health nurses provide home visits to offer additional support for pregnant women who are at risk. They offer education and support, connect moms & families to resources. Billing is submitted to BadgerCare for Medicaid eligible client visits.

name: Childhood Lead Consolidated Contract Grant
description: Screening and education is provided by WIC staff and Public Health Nurses to the parents/caregivers regarding effects of a high blood lead level on the child's health, environmental health assessment is conducted to determine source(s) of contamination, information/resources for clean-up or abatement. Follow-up provided on all blood lead levels >5ug/dl.

name: Child Safety & Injury Prevention
description: Programs focus on reducing and preventing injuries/death to keep children and families healthy and safe: Keeping Kids Alive, Child Death Review Team (CDRT), Zero Suicide, Cribs 4 Kids (Safe Sleep) & Bureau of Transportation (BOTS Grant) free car seat program.

name: 24/7 on-call consultation for communicable disease, emergencies & disasters
description: The Health Department has an on-call call-up list for medical providers and emergency responders. The majority of the calls are answered by the Director/Health Officer and/or Public Health Program Manager.

name: Human Services Mental Health Nursing - CSP; CCS; HS Meds
description: Registered Nurse works with CSP clients at the Lueder Haus providing routine psychotropic injections and/or venipuncture for lab tests per M.D. orders, health education and assessments. Jefferson County Human Services is billed for reimbursement of payroll expenses, office supplies and medical supplies monthly.

name: Engineering/Project Design and Planning
description: Manage the development of standard details and project specifications

name: Traffic Engineering Studies/Data Collection
description: Conduct speed volume traffic signal and stop sign warrant studies as requested

name: Bridge Inspection
description: Perform bridge inspections

name: Fleet Maintenance and Repair
description: Fleet maintenance and repairs for all vehicles

name: Facility and Grounds Maintenance & Repairs
description: Repair Clean and Paint Interior and exterior Buildings as well as Parking lots

name: Facility Custodial & Light Maintenance
description: Clean sanitize and restock products at city facilities

name: Road Construction Grading
description: Excavation of roadway subgrade in ROW

name: Asphalt Paving
description: Paving work for both maintenance and improvement projects

name: Culvert Maintenance and Replacement
description: Repair, Replace, and Line culverts in the ROW

name: Employee Safety/Operations Training
description: Safety and operations training for all department employees

name: Sign Maintenance and Replacement
description: Repair or replace damaged signs

name: Traffic and  Work Zone Control
description: Placement and removal of signs cones impact attenuators arrow boards and other devices

name: Winter Maintenance - Snow Plowing
description: Plow and apply deicing materials to county highways

name: Winter Maintenance  - Materials Management
description: Apply liquid anti icing chemicals prior to the start of a storm or icing event including frost and black ice prevention

name: Crack Sealing - Pavement Maintenance
description: Place liquid asphalt treatments in cracks in pavement

name: Chip Sealing - Pavement Maintenance
description: Place asphalt materials and cover aggregate to seal surface of pavement

name: Bridge Maintenance
description: Maintenance work on all bridges (Routine and repairs)

name: Drainage Maintenance
description: Repair and improve drainage inspect and maintain ditches and culverts

name: Litter and Debris Removal
description: Remove objects from roadways which may impact safe travel

name: Guard Rail Installation and Repairs
description: Repair damaged guard rails on city right of way

name: Tree and Brush Removal
description: Remove trees and brush on highway ROW

name: Pavement Markings and Striping
description: Schedule roadway markings and striping

name: ADRC
description: Provide accurate, unbiased information on all aspects of life related to aging or living with a disability; and serves as the access point for publicly-funded long term care.

name: Disability Benefits Specialist (DBS)
description: Provide adults with disabling conditions benefit counseling and advocacy services

name: Elder Benefit Specialist (EBS)
description: Help answer questions and solve problems related to Social Security, Medicare, health insurance and other publicÂ and private benefits for older adults.Â  They serve people ages 60 and over.

name: Adult Protective Services (APS) & Elder Abuse
description: Ensure vulnerable adults, aged 18+ are aware of and have access to Adult Protective Services 24/7

name: Senior Dining Program
description: Serve & deliver, without interruption, well-balanced meals to seniors who request them in our service area, and to those who have the greatest economic or social need

name: Transportation
description: Provide medical transportation to seniors and persons with dis-abilities and rides to department appointments.

name: Alzheimers Family Support
description: Provides funding to families in response to the stress and services needs of caring at home for someone with irreversible dementia

name: Guardianship Program
description: Provides funding, information, and assistance on issues related to guardianship, protective placement, advance directives.

name: Title III-B Supportive Services
description: Provides personal care and hommeaker services for frail and elderly.

name: Title III-D Disease Prevention and Health Promotion
description: Evidence-based health promotion/disease prevention programs

name: Title III-E Family Caregiver Support
description: Provides caregivers with information about available services; assistance in gaining access to services; individual counseling, support groups and training; respite care

name: Community Support Program
description: Integrated services for people with severe and persistent mental illness

name: Community Recovery Services
description: Residential services for people with mental health and substance abuse

name: Comprehensive Community Services
description: Recovery based community, mental health, and substance abuse services

name: Emergency Mental Health
description: 24/7 mobile response to all crisis call

name: Outpatient Alcohol and Other Drugs Clinic
description: Treatment services for substance use including opioid addictions

name: Outpatient Mental Health Clinic
description: Provide mental health counseling

name: Lueder Haus
description: Serves as an acute care facility for chronic mentally ill adults who are in immediate crisis but not in need of hospitalization

name: IDP Assessments and Treatment Services
description: Intoxicated Driver Program - provides treatment and services

name: Birth to Three
description: Supporting Families in promoting the growth and development of their children.

name: Children in Need of Protective Services
description: Monitor safety, well-being, and permanence for all children found to be in need of protection or services by the courts.

name: Children Long Term Support
description: Home and Community-based services that provide Medicaid funding for children with substantial functional needs

name: Intake
description: Provides a single access point for all child, juvenile and family service needs.

name: Youth Justice Integrated Services
description: Provide evidence based treatment and supervision to all court ordered youth.

name: Kinship Care
description: Supports the care of children by relatives

name: In Home Safety Services
description: Indentifies opportunities to control safety threats in the home, allowing children to stay in the home

name: Post-Reunification Support
description: Enhanced services and supports to those families who are most at risk of experiencing a re-entry into out-of-home care

name: Community Response
description: Provides voluntary supports to strengthen families, prevent child abuse and neglect, and reduce re-referrals to CPS

name: IV-E Legal
description: Supports the expansion of legal services for child welfare programs.

name: Food Share-Food Stamps
description: Provides financial assistance to purchase food for those who meet income guidelines.

name: Medical Assistance and Market Place exchanges
description: Provides Health Insurance benefits for those who meet income guidelines.

name: County Transports
description: Transporting inmates to and from other county and municipal jails and for court medical dental etc

name: Extraditions
description: Handle in coming and out going extraditions from out of state setting up travel plans etc

name: Housing of Inmates
description: The housing and security of arrested offenders

name: Jail Security
description: Maintain jail security by completing cell checks random prisoner counts monitoring cell areas on surveillance equipment etc

name: Outpatient Substance Abuse
description: This program is a variable length substance abuse treatment program - Human Services

name: Correctional Emergency Response Team
description: Utilized to respond to inmates whom have become aggressive and/or violent.

name: Inmate Court Activity
description: Escort Prisoners to court, maintain security and document and update inhouse records on court proceedings

name: Water Resource Planning & Protection Projects
description: Staff plan and implement projects by writing/assisting with grant applications, performing data collection, organizing/leading public meetings, working with consultants, working on permits, writing reports, and tracking financials.

name: Livestock Siting
description: Farms that plan to expand their livestock numbers above a certain threshold must adhere to standards and obtain a Conditional Use Permit.  The Land & Water Conservation Department explains the process and standards to farmers, reviews application materials for completeness, provides information to the Zoning Department and Committee, provides testimony at the public hearing, and inspects the farms and construction to ensure compliance with the laws.

name: Agriculture Performance Standards & Prohibitions
description: State law identifies minimum performance standards that agricultural landowners and farm operators must meet. Staff conduct site evaluations to determine compliance with the law. If issues are identified, staff work to find solutions and funding to bring operations into compliance.

name: Animal Waste Storage Permitting
description: Issue permits for new or substantially altered manure storage  and closure of storage once construction plans and nutrient management plans meet standards set for in the County ordinance. Inspect construction to document adherence to standards.

name: Land & Water Resource Management Plan
description: This plan lays out the mission, goals, and work plan for the Land and Water Conservation Department. The plan also provides an overview of the land and water resources in the county. It is updated every 10 years.

name: Water Quality Monitoring
description: Staff take part in water quality monitoring projects.  Staff train, equip, and support citizens to monitor lakes and streams in partnership with the Department of Natural Resources, Water Action Volunteers, and Rock River Coalition.  Results are tracked and shared with partners and citizens.

name: Farmland Preservation Program
description: The Farmland Preservation Program offers farm owners a tax credit for protecting our Stateâ€™s soil and water resources. Work includes writing conservation plans, farm inspections, developing plans to achieve compliance, determining compliance schedules, and providing a list of compliant farms to the state. Staff educate tax prepares about the program.

name: Maintain Uniform Numbering Ordinance
description: Assign addresses for all new residences and businesses in the un-incorporated areas of Jefferson County.  Update Official Uniform Numbering GIS data. Distribute address changes to 911 dispatch and US Postal Service.

name: Maintenance Enterprise GIS Layers
description: Maintenance of numerous enterprise  GIS data layers for county zoning, address, roads, municipality boundaries, wards, supervisory districts. EMS, fire response, schools districts, outdoor recreation facilities, farmland preservation, etc.

name: County Facility Management and Infrastructure
description: To support the overall goals and objectives of the county as a whole.  Example: support and facilitate projects susch as tax foreclosures, building demolition, and infrastructure projects.

name: County Parks â€“ Grounds Maintenance
description: Maintain a regular schedule for mowing, trimming, spraying, flower bed maintenance, shrub and tree pruning, trail clearing, and general grounds maintenance of the Countyâ€™s 20 parks, glacial river bike trail, Glacial River Mountain Bike Trail, and general fishing accessâ€™ across the county.

name: County Parks â€“ Building and Facility Maintenance
description: Maintain the buildings and facilities in the 20 county parks including 16 shelters, 21 restrooms, 11 playgrounds, split rail fences, observation decks, piers, fishing wharf, 4 boat launches, disc golf course, light poles, picnic tables, grills, electrical systems, plumbing systems, and parking lots.  This includes janitorial services, trash removal, painting, staining, light repair, seasonal opening and closing, asphalt patching, playground inspection and monitoring, and the overall monitoring of facilities for vandalism and damage.

name: County Parks â€“ Building and Facility Maintenance County Park Shop
description: Maintain the operation, function, and integrity of the County Parks shop including regularly scheduled services such as backflow valve prevention inspection, fuel system inspections, fire extinguisher inspections, bi-annual service of Hotsy Pressure Washer, maintenance of oil furnace, quarterly inspection of exit lights and emergency lighting, and maintaining an inventory of supplies and equipment.

name: County Parks â€“ Staff Training and Safety Program
description: Provide annual training to staff on all levels of experience in safety, personal development, and Best Management Practices of park and recreation management.  Keep staff certifications up to date.

name: County Parks â€“ Fleet Maintenance and Purchasing
description: Maintain regular schedule of preventive and scheduled maintenance on all parks equipment.  Train seasonal staff on general preventive maintenance and regularly scheduled maintenance for all assigned equipment.  Schedule all non-routine maintenance and breakdowns with certified mechanic shop.  Prioritize and create regular intervals for equipment replacement within the budgetary system.  Research options for new equipment, develop bid specifications for equipment replacement, and purchase new equipment.  Provide admin with budgetary numbers for future replacements.

name: County Parks â€“ Glacial Heritage Area Watertrails Management and Development
description: Keep current GHA water trail maps and Put In Take Out signage up to date at 70 different sites.  Work with Volunteers and Park staff to maintain safe waterways for paddlers and improve launch sites when funding and time is available.

name: County Parks â€“ Bike Route Development and Maintenance
description: Design, fund, engineer, build,monitor and maintain Jefferson Countyâ€™s on-road and off-road bike trails, mountain bike trails and community connections which includes planning, inventory updates, reroutes, and maintenance of route signage throughout the county.  Also update and maintain the Jefferson County Bike Routes Map and Loop Guides.

name: County Parks â€“ Snow Removal and Winter maintenance
description: Timely and appropriate response to winter storm conditions including plowing, shoveling, salting, and sanding.  Providing winter recreation opportunities including cross country skiing, sledding, dog walking, and snowshoeing.  Maintain year round access to county parks, restrooms, and trails.

name: County Parks â€“ Snowmobile Trail Program
description: Work directly with Jefferson County Snowmobile Alliance Trail Coordinator to open and close trails, monitor trail signage, investigate accidents, and monitor compliance with contract obligations.  Work with Wisconsin DNR Motorized Vehicle representatives to ensure compliance with program grant funding.

name: County Parks â€“ Management of Flood Mitigation and Tax Foreclosure Properties
description: Monitor compliance of Jefferson Countyâ€™s 120+ Flood Mitigation properties according to the FEMA HMAUG requirements through a bi-annual inspection program.  Monitor all properties for forest health issues and possible liability issues associated with dead and dying ash trees, and mitigate as funds are available.  Work with the County Attorneyâ€™s office on preparation for sale of County Tax Foreclosure properties.  Complete all steps and permitting for the demolition of tax foreclosed and condemned properties as well as newly purchased flood mitigation properties.

name: County Parks â€“ Forestry
description: Monitor and inventory trees within recreation spaces and county owned properties for damage from storms, insects, fungus or other forest health pathogens or structural deficiencies.  Prioritize and mitigate hazards in a timely fashion.  Plan and implement a tree replacement program when funds are available and where appropriate.

name: County Facilities â€“ Grounds Maintenance
description: Maintain a regular schedule for mowing, trimming, spraying, flower bed maintenance, shrub and tree pruning, trail clearing, and general grounds maintenance of the Countyâ€™s 4 campuses (10 buildings) and the fair park.

name: County Facilities â€“ Grounds Improvements Planning and Implementation
description: Work with facility managers to plan for improvements around county facilities including landscaping, retaining wall, tree removals and plantings, sitting areas, and gardens.

name: County Facilities â€“ Snow Removal and Winter Maintenance
description: Support other facility managers in the timely removal of snow and ice from county parking lots, sidewalks, and driveways.

name: Drug Disposal
description: Partner with state and local agencies to offer drug disposal locations and methods for residents

name: Clean Sweep Events
description: Plan, coordinante, administer Clean Sweep Events for the County

name: Shoreland/Shoreland-Wetland Ordinance
description: Administer ordinance as mandated per State Statute 59.692, 87.30, including land owner and contractor assistance, permit review and issuance, conducting public hearings, inspections, and enforcement. (Chapter 22)

name: Private Onsite Wastewater Treatment System Ordinance, Permits and Inspections
description: Administer ordinance mandated per State Statutes 59.70(1), 59.70(5),145.04, 145.19, 145.20, 145.245, including land owner and contractor assistance, permit review/approval and issuance,  inspections, and enforcement.

name: Private Onsite Wastewater Treatment System (POWTS) Maintenance
description: Administer maintenance program per SPS 382, 383, 384, 385 and 391 Administrative Code, including informing and educating the  landowners of requirements to maintain systems, and enforcement. (Chapter 15).

name: Vital Records  Maintenance
description: Maintain a permanent record of all vital records, issue certified copies of birth, marriage, domestic partnership,divorce and death records, accept and file marriage, domestic partnerships and death records.

name: Prisoner Escorts
description: Process and transport offenders taken into custody by the court

name: Prisoner Management
description: Transport, Search, Secure, and Manage Behavior of Prisoners

name: Disaster and Emergency Planning and Response
description: Provide communications capabilities, planning, exercises, jurisdictional coordination, and other planning efforts needed to prepare for, respond to, and recover from emergencies and disasters.

name: Criminal Screenings and Appeals
description: Review of criminal issues (screenings) and expungements.

name: Criminal (Justice Court)
description: Prosecution of specific case(s) and Consultation on all criminal issues (i.e.. police, fire, code, development services, public works etc.)

name: Building Inspection
description: Building inspection includes residential and commercial inspections, as well as fire inspections and foundation drain inspections.

name: Traffic Management
description: The traffic management program includes traffic counts, traffic signal maintenance, traffic calming and speed management, and bicycle and pedestrian planning.

name: Community Outreach and Education
description: Community education programs (i.e., CPR, fire extinguisher classes, first-aid classes, community education, fire station tours, etc.). Includes Public Access AED installation and rebate program as well as lay rescuer CPR/AED training, “Stop the Bleed” training, “Ready, Set, Go!” and other community programs identified to increase community preparedness and resiliency.

name: Fire Prevention
description: Community risk reduction and prevention efforts including business inspections, code compliance, hydrant inspections, and checking Public Access AEDs.

name: EMS Response Service
description: Activities and expenses related to delivering Emergency Medical Services and other non-fire/rescue/hazmat -response related services (i.e., Basic and Advanced Life Support [BLS/ALS] services, patient care, ambulance transportation, and patient lift assistance).

name: Hazardous Materials Service
description: All hazardous materials response services, including training, pre-planning and prevention efforts, as well as response and mitigation of hazards related to intentional and unintentional releases of chemical, biological, radiological, and explosive materials.

name: Technical Rescue
description: Training and incident response/recovery for technical rescue-related calls for service within SJC and other mutual aid jurisdictions.
